sledgehammer.manager

Class EventManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • sledgehammer.util.Printable
      • sledgehammer.manager.Manager
        • sledgehammer.manager.EventManager

  • public class EventManager
extends Manager
    This manager handles the Events fired in the Sledgehammer Engine, and Craftboid.
    Author:
    Jab

      • onLoad

        public void onLoad(boolean debug)
        Description copied from class: Manager
        Executed when loading the module. Objects and Permission contexts (from listeners), should be defined here. It is HIGHLY recommended to use this area for declarations, as it is more organized and helps with handling unloading and reloading module-tier objects. This is not mandatory.
        Overrides:
        onLoad in class Manager
        Parameters:
        debug - Flag for debug testing.

      • onStart

        public void onStart()
        Description copied from class: Manager
        Executed when starting the module. Listeners should be registered here.
        Overrides:
        onStart in class Manager

      • onShutDown

        public void onShutDown()
        Description copied from class: Manager
        Executed when unloading, and shutting down the module. It is HIGHLY recommended to nullify module-tier objects at this point. If the module is restarted, onLoad() is called again.
        Overrides:
        onShutDown in class Manager

      • handleEvent

        public Event handleEvent(Event event,
                         boolean log)
        Handles a Event by sending the Event to all registered EventHandlers for the Event type.

        If the event given is null, a IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        event - The Event to handle.
        log - Flag to issue a LogEvent after handling the Event.

      • handleCommand

        public CommandEvent handleCommand(Command command)
        Handles a Command by packaging it as a CommandEvent and handling the Event, then logging it.

        All Command listeners must use a EventHandler method for the event.

        Parameters:
        command - The Command to handle as a CommandEvent.
        Returns:
        Returns the CommandEvent result.

      • handleCommand

        public CommandEvent handleCommand(Command command,
                                  boolean log)
        Handles a Command by packaging it as a CommandEvent and handling the Event.

        All Command listeners must use a EventHandler method for the event.

        Parameters:
        command - The Command to handle as a CommandEvent.
        log - Set to true to log the event.
        Returns:
        Returns the CommandEvent result.

      • handleCommand

        public CommandEvent handleCommand(zombie.core.raknet.UdpConnection connection,
                                  java.lang.String input)
        Handles a command, and logs it.
        Parameters:
        connection - The native UdpConnection representing the origin of the sender.
        input - The String input given. This is a pre-Command as a raw input.
        Returns:
        Returns the result CommandEvent.

      • handleCommand

        public CommandEvent handleCommand(zombie.core.raknet.UdpConnection connection,
                                  java.lang.String input,
                                  boolean logEvent)
        Handles a command.
        Parameters:
        connection - The native UdpConnection representing the origin of the sender.
        input - The String input given. This is a pre-Command as a raw input.
        logEvent - Flag to log the CommandEvent.
        Returns:
        Returns the result CommandEvent.

      • handleThrown

        public ThrowableEvent handleThrown(java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        Handles a thrown Throwable by packaging it as a ThrowableEvent and handling the Event.

        All Throwable listeners must use a EventHandler method for the event.

        Parameters:
        throwable - The Throwable to handle as a ThrowableEvent.
        Returns:
        Returns the ThrowableEvent result.

      • register

        public void register(Listener listener)
        Registers a given Listener. All EventHandlers declared in the Listener will be registered into the EventManager's EventHandler registry.

        If a null is given for the Listener parameter, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        If the Listener instance is already registered, none of the EventHandlers will be registered. This allows for multiple instances of the same class to be registered, although this is not recommended.

        Parameters:
        listener - The Listener to register.

      • unregister

        public void unregister(Listener Listener)
        Unregisters all handlers registered with the given listener instance.
        Parameters:
        Listener - The listener instance to unregister all handlers registered that identify with the listener instance.

      • getContainer

        public EventHandlerContainer getContainer(java.lang.String id)
        This returns a event handler container that represents a event handler registered to the event manager. If no container is identified with the ID given, null is returned.

        If a null or empty ID is passed, a IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        id - The string ID of the event handler.
        Returns:
        Returns a event handler container identified with the id given. If no event handler is registered with the ID given, null is returned.

      • getContainer

        public EventHandlerContainer getContainer(Event event,
                                          java.lang.String id)
        This returns a CommandHandlerContainer that represents a EventHandler registered to the EventManager for the Event given. If no container is identified with the ID given, null is returned.

        If a null or empty ID is given, a IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If a null Event is given, a IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        event - The Event that the EventHandler handles.
        id - The String ID of the EventHandler.
        Returns:
        Returns a CommandHandlerContainer with the ID given. If no EventHandler is registered with the ID given, null is returned.

      • getContainer

        public EventHandlerContainer getContainer(java.lang.Class<? extends Event> classEvent,
                                          java.lang.String id)
        This returns a CommandHandlerContainer that represents a EventHandler registered to the EventManager for the class of the Event given. If no container is identified with the ID given, null is returned.

        If a null or empty ID is given, a IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If a null class is given, a IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        classEvent - The Class of the Event that the EventHandler handles.
        id - The String ID of te EventHandler.
        Returns:
        Returns a CommandHandlerContainer with the ID given. If no EventHandler is registered with the ID given, null is returned.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the EventManager by removing all EventHandlers from the registry.

        public java.lang.String printCommandHandler(CommandHandlerContainer container,
                                            java.lang.String prefix)

      • getEventHandlers

        public java.util.LinkedList<EventHandlerContainer> getEventHandlers(Event event)
        This returns the List of registered EventHandlers for a given Event to handle.
        Parameters:
        event - The Event that is handled.
        Returns:
        Returns a LinkedList of ordered EventHandlers that handle the Event given. If no listeners are assigned to the event, null is returned.

      • getEventHandlers

        public java.util.LinkedList<EventHandlerContainer> getEventHandlers(java.lang.Class<? extends Event> classEvent)
        This returns the List of registered EventHandlers for a given Event to handle.
        Parameters:
        classEvent - The Class of the Event that is handled.
        Returns:
        Returns a LinkedList of ordered EventHandlers that handle the Event given. If no listeners are assigned to the event, null is returned.
